result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Criminal Trespass, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Criminal Trespass, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Defendant to report to the House of Correction on November 3, 2022 by 5:00 p.m.
Consecutive to count 2 and count 3. Huber privileges for employment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 3. Straight time.
Defendant to contact the probation office by 10/24/2022 by 5:00 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is prohibited actively managing any properties during the term of probation.
No contact with S.A.L.

Provide DNA specimen by 11/3/2022 and pay DNA surcharge.
Defendant to pay mandatory cost, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge during the term of probation or civil judgment.
Pay restitution in the amount of $2600.00 to S.A.L. during term of probation or civil judgment.

Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or civil judgment.
Cooperate with agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 2.  Straight time.

records.addlTxt:
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 , COUNT 2 and COUNT 3 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  
Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. 
Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. 
State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant. Additional Statement made by KT an MM

AS TO COUNT 1: 
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve  4 MONTHS  in  the House of Correction to run consecutive to Count 2 and Count 3  with Zero Days of pretrial incarceration credit.  
Huber privileges for employment.  Defendant to Report to the House of Correction on NOVEMBER 3, 2022 BY 5:00PM.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 9 Months ( Straight time) in  the House of Correction to run Concurrent to Count 3 with Zero days of pretrial incarceration credit.  
Court  IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2 Years. 

AS TO COUNT 3 
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 9 Months (Straight time) in  the House of Correction to run Concurrent to Count 2 with Zero days of pretrial incarceration credit.  
Court  IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2 Years. 

Defendant is prohibited actively managing any properties during the term of probation. 
Defendant to pay mandatory cost, fees  and surcharges (including DNA surcharge during the term of probation or Civil Judgment. 
Provide DNA specimen by 11-3-2022 and Pay DNA surcharge
Pay all Supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or Civil Judgment.
Pay Restitution in the amount of $2600.00  to SAL during term of probation  or Civil Judgment.
Defendant to Contact the Probation Office by 10-24-2022 by 5:00pm. 
Cooperate with Agent. 
No Contact with SAL.  
Appellate Rights given

Defendant Steven D Wolf in court.  
Attorney Melissa Ivens in court for Steven D Wolf.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Received and Filed. Letter to Judge
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed by Melissa Ivens.

Defendant Steven D Wolf in court with attorney Kendrick Yandell.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven D Wolf
Current: 1650 S 116th St Apt 8, West Allis, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 2024 South 73rd Street, West Allis, WI 53219

Defendant Steven D Wolf in court with attorney Melissa Ivens on behalf of attorney Kendrick Yandell.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting more time to go through discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:28 AM Defendant Steven D Wolf in court with Attorney Kendrick Yandell.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brian Steffen - West Allis Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 038827,
Payable Number: 1001425,
Receipt Number: 22RP016335,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with S.A.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Steven D Wolf in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Steven D Wolf in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven D Wolf appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  
 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
